00033 #include <assert.h>

00044 void
00045 cparser_print_prompt (const cparser_t *parser)
00046 {
00047     assert(parser);
00048     if (cparser_is_in_privileged_mode(parser)) {
00049         parser->cfg.printc(parser, '+');
00050     }
00051     parser->cfg.prints(parser, parser->prompt[parser->root_level]);
00052 }
00053 
00066 static void
00067 cparser_help_print_node (cparser_t *parser, cparser_node_t *node,
00068                          const int add_lf, const int print_desc)
00069 {
00070     assert(parser && node);
00071     if (!NODE_USABLE(parser, node)) {
00072         return;
00073     }
00074     if (add_lf) {
00075         parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00076     }
00077     switch (node->type) {
00078         case CPARSER_NODE_ROOT:
00079             assert(0); /* this should never happen */
00080         case CPARSER_NODE_END:
00081             parser->cfg.prints(parser, "<LF>");
00082             break;
00083         case CPARSER_NODE_LIST:
00084             parser->cfg.prints(parser, "[ ");
00085             cparser_list_node_t *lnode = (cparser_list_node_t *)node->param;
00086             assert(lnode);
00087             while (lnode) {
00088                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, lnode->keyword);
00089                 lnode = lnode->next;
00090                 if (lnode) {
00091                     parser->cfg.prints(parser, " | ");
00092                 }
00093             }
00094             parser->cfg.prints(parser, " ]");
00095             break;
00096         default:
00097             parser->cfg.prints(parser, node->param);
00098             if (print_desc && node->desc) {
00099                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, " - ");
00100                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, node->desc);
00101             }
00102             break;
00103     }
00104 }
00105 
00114 static void
00115 cparser_print_error (cparser_t *parser, const char *msg)
00116 {
00117     int n, m;
00118 
00119     assert(parser && msg);
00120 
00121     parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00122     m = strlen(parser->prompt[parser->root_level]) + 1;
00123     for (n = 0; n < m+parser->last_good; n++) {
00124         parser->cfg.printc(parser, ' ');
00125     }
00126     parser->cfg.printc(parser, '^');
00127     parser->cfg.prints(parser, msg);
00128 }

00135 static void
00136 cparser_input_reset (cparser_t *parser)
00137 {
00138     assert(parser);
00139     parser->user_buf = NULL;
00140     parser->user_buf_size = 0;
00141     parser->user_buf_count = 0;
00142     parser->user_input_cb = NULL;
00143 }
00144 
00145 int
00146 cparser_is_user_input (cparser_t *parser, int *do_echo)
00147 {
00148     assert(parser && do_echo);
00149     if (parser->user_buf) {
00150         assert(parser->user_input_cb && parser->user_buf_size);
00151         *do_echo = parser->user_do_echo;
00152         return 1;
00153     }
00154     assert(!parser->user_input_cb && !parser->user_buf_size);
00155     *do_echo = 0;
00156     return 0;
00157 }
00158 
00159 static void
00160 cparser_record_command (cparser_t *parser, cparser_result_t rc)
00161 {
00162     assert(parser);
00163 
00164     /* Save the state of the command */
00165     parser->last_line_idx = CURRENT_LINE(parser);
00166     parser->last_rc = rc;
00167     parser->last_end_node = parser->cur_node;
00168 }
00169 
00180 static cparser_result_t
00181 cparser_execute_cmd (cparser_t *parser)
00182 {
00183     int do_echo;
00184     cparser_result_t rc = CPARSER_OK;
00185     assert(VALID_PARSER(parser));
00186 
00187     /*
00188      * Enter a command. There are three possibilites:
00189      * 1. If we are in WHITESPACE state, we check if there is
00190      *    only one child of keyword type. If yes, we recurse
00191      *    into it and repeat until either: a) there is more than
00192      *    one choice, b) We are at a END node. If there is more
00193      *    than one choice, we look for an END node. In either
00194      *    case, if an END node is found, we execute the action
00195      *    function.
00196      *
00197      * 2. If we are in TOKEN state, we check if we have an unique
00198      *    match. If yes, re recurse into it and repeat just
00199      *    like WHITESPACE state until we find an END node.
00200      *
00201      * 3. If we are in ERROR state, we print out an error.
00202      *
00203      * Afterward, we reset the parser state and move to the
00204      * next line buffer.
00205      */
00206     if ((CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN == parser->state) ||
00207         (CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE == parser->state)) {
00208         cparser_node_t *child;
00209 
00210         if (CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN == parser->state) {
00211             cparser_token_t *token;
00212             cparser_node_t *match;
00213             int is_complete;
00214 
00215             token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00216             if ((1 <= cparser_match(parser, token->buf, token->token_len,
00217                                     parser->cur_node, &match,
00218                                     &is_complete)) &&
00219                 (is_complete)) {
00220                 cparser_complete_fn fn = cparser_complete_fn_tbl[match->type];
00221                 if (fn) {
00222                     fn(parser, match, token->buf, token->token_len);
00223                 }
00224                 rc = cparser_input(parser, ' ', CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00225                 assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00226             } else {
00227                 cparser_print_error(parser, "Incomplete command\n");
00228                 rc = CPARSER_ERR_INCOMP_CMD;
00229 
00230                 /* Reset the internal buffer, state and cur_node */
00231                 cparser_record_command(parser, rc);
00232                 cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00233                 cparser_print_prompt(parser);
00234                 return rc;
00235             }
00236         }
00237 
00238         /* Look for a single keyword node child */
00239         child = parser->cur_node->children;
00240         assert(child);
00241         while ((CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD == child->type) &&
00242                NODE_USABLE(parser, child) && (!child->sibling)) {
00243             cparser_token_t *token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00244             cparser_complete_keyword(parser, child, token->buf, token->token_len);
00245             rc = cparser_input(parser, ' ', CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00246             assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00247 
00248             child = parser->cur_node->children;
00249             assert(child);
00250         }
00251 
00252         /* Look for an end node */
00253         child = parser->cur_node->children;
00254         while ((NULL != child) &&
00255                !((CPARSER_NODE_END == child->type) && NODE_USABLE(parser, child))) {
00256             child = child->sibling;
00257         }
00258         if (child) {
00259             assert(CPARSER_NODE_END == child->type);
00260 
00261             /* Execute the glue function */
00262             parser->cur_node = child;
00263             parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00264             rc = ((cparser_glue_fn)child->param)(parser);
00265         } else {
00266             if (parser->token_tos) {
00267                 cparser_print_error(parser, "Incomplete command\n");
00268                 rc = CPARSER_ERR_INCOMP_CMD;
00269             }
00270 
00271             /* Reset FSM states and advance to the next line */
00272             cparser_record_command(parser, rc);
00273             cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00274             if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00275                 /* This is just a blank line */
00276                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00277             }
00278             cparser_print_prompt(parser);
00279             return rc;
00280         }
00281     } else if (CPARSER_STATE_ERROR == parser->state) {
00282         cparser_print_error(parser, "Parse error\n");
00283         rc = CPARSER_ERR_PARSE_ERR;
00284     }
00285 
00286     /* Reset FSM states and advance to the next line */
00287     cparser_record_command(parser, rc);
00288     cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00289     if (!cparser_is_user_input(parser, &do_echo)) {
00290         cparser_print_prompt(parser);
00291     }
00292     return rc;
00293 }
00294 
00295 static cparser_result_t
00296 cparser_match_prefix (const cparser_t *parser, const char *token,
00297                       const int token_len, const cparser_node_t *parent,
00298                       const char ch, const int offset)
00299 {
00300     int local_is_complete;
00301     cparser_node_t *child;
00302     cparser_result_t rc;
00303 
00304     assert(parent && ch);
00305     for (child = parent->children; NULL != child; child = child->sibling) {
00306         if (!NODE_USABLE(parser, child)) {
00307             continue;
00308         }
00309         rc = cparser_match_fn_tbl[child->type](token, token_len, child,
00310                                                &local_is_complete);
00311         if (CPARSER_NOT_OK == rc) {
00312             continue;
00313         }
00314         if (CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD != child->type) {
00315             return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00316         }
00317 
00318         /* There is a match. Make sure that it is part of this node as well */
00319         if (*((char *)child->param + offset) != ch) {
00320             return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00321         }
00322     }
00323     return CPARSER_OK;
00324 }
00325 
00331 static cparser_result_t
00332 cparser_help (cparser_t *parser)
00333 {
00334     cparser_node_t *node;
00335     cparser_token_t *token;
00336     int local_is_complete;
00337 
00338     assert(VALID_PARSER(parser));
00339     if (CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE == parser->state) {
00340         /* Just print out every children */
00341         for (node = parser->cur_node->children; NULL != node;
00342              node = node->sibling) {
00343             cparser_help_print_node(parser, node, 1, 1);
00344         }
00345     } else if (CPARSER_STATE_ERROR == parser->state) {
00346         /*
00347          * We have some problem parsing. Just print out the last known
00348          * good parse point and list the valid options.
00349          */
00350         cparser_print_error(parser, "Last known good parse point.");
00351         for (node = parser->cur_node->children; NULL != node;
00352              node = node->sibling) {
00353             cparser_help_print_node(parser, node, 1, 1);
00354         }
00355     } else {
00356         /* We have a partial match */
00357         node = parser->cur_node->children;
00358         token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00359         for (node = parser->cur_node->children; NULL != node;
00360              node = node->sibling) {
00361             if (!NODE_USABLE(parser, node)) {
00362                 continue;
00363             }
00364             if (CPARSER_OK ==
00365                 cparser_match_fn_tbl[node->type](token->buf, token->token_len,
00366                                                  node, &local_is_complete)) {
00367                 cparser_help_print_node(parser, node, 1, 1);
00368             }
00369         }
00370     }
00371     cparser_line_print(parser, 1, 1);
00372     return CPARSER_OK;
00373 }
00374 
00383 static int
00384 cparser_complete_one_level (cparser_t *parser)
00385 {
00386     cparser_token_t *token;
00387     cparser_node_t *match;
00388     int is_complete = 0, num_matches, keep_going = 0, rc;
00389     char *ch_ptr;
00390 
00391     switch (parser->state) {
00392         case CPARSER_STATE_ERROR:
00393             /* If we are in ERROR, there cannot be a match. So, just quit */
00394             parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\a');
00395             break;
00396         case CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE:
00397             if (parser->cur_node && parser->cur_node->children &&
00398                 !parser->cur_node->children->sibling &&
00399                 (CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD == parser->cur_node->children->type)) {
00400                 ch_ptr = parser->cur_node->children->param;
00401                 while (*ch_ptr) {
00402                     rc = cparser_input(parser, *ch_ptr, CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00403                     assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00404                     ch_ptr++;
00405                 }
00406                 rc = cparser_input(parser, ' ', CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00407                 assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00408             } else {
00409                 /*
00410                  * If we are in WHITESPACE, just dump all children. Since there is no
00411                  * way any token can match to a NULL string.
00412                  */
00413                 cparser_help(parser);
00414             }
00415             break;
00416         case CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN:
00417         {
00418             /* Complete a command */
00419             token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00420             num_matches = cparser_match(parser, token->buf, token->token_len,
00421                                         parser->cur_node, &match,
00422                                         &is_complete);
00423             if ((1 == num_matches) && (is_complete)) {
00424                 cparser_complete_fn fn = cparser_complete_fn_tbl[match->type];
00425                 /*
00426                  * If the only matched node is a keyword, we feel the rest of
00427                  * keyword in. Otherwise, we assume this parameter is complete
00428                  * and just insert a space.
00429                  */
00430                 if (fn) {
00431                     fn(parser, match, token->buf, token->token_len);
00432                 }
00433                 rc = cparser_input(parser, ' ', CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00434                 assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00435 
00436                 keep_going = 1;
00437             } else {
00438                 int offset, orig_offset;
00439                 /*
00440                  * If we have more than one match, we should try to complete
00441                  * as much as possible. To do that, we grab the node in the
00442                  * (first) matched node and check that the next character
00443                  * from it is common among all matched nodes. If it is common
00444                  * to all matched nodes, we continue to feed them into the
00445                  * parser. However, this is only useful for keywords. If there
00446                  * is a parameter token in the match, we automatically abort.
00447                  */
00448                 offset = orig_offset = token->token_len;
00449                 ch_ptr = match->param + token->token_len;
00450                 while (('\0' != *ch_ptr) &&
00451                        (CPARSER_OK ==
00452                         cparser_match_prefix(parser, token->buf, token->token_len,
00453                                              parser->cur_node, *ch_ptr,
00454                                              offset))) {
00455                     rc = cparser_input(parser, *ch_ptr, CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR);
00456                     assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00457                     ch_ptr++;
00458                     offset++;
00459                 }
00460                 if (orig_offset == offset) {
00461                     /* If there is no common prefix at all, just display help */
00462                     cparser_help(parser);
00463                 }
00464             }
00465             break;
00466         }
00467         default: assert(0);
00468     }
00469 
00470     return keep_going;
00471 }
00472 
00473 cparser_result_t
00474 cparser_input (cparser_t *parser, char ch, cparser_char_t ch_type)
00475 {
00476     int n, do_echo;
00477     cparser_result_t rc;
00478 
00479     if (!VALID_PARSER(parser)) {
00480         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00481     }
00482 
00483     if (cparser_is_user_input(parser, &do_echo)) {
00484         /* Process user input */
00485         if (CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR != ch_type) {
00486             return CPARSER_OK;
00487         }
00488         if ('\n' == ch) {
00489             /* We have a complete input. Call the callback. */
00490             assert(parser->user_input_cb);
00491             parser->user_buf[parser->user_buf_count] = '\0';
00492             rc = parser->user_input_cb(parser, parser->user_buf,
00493                                        parser->user_buf_count);
00494             cparser_input_reset(parser);
00495             cparser_print_prompt(parser);
00496             return rc;
00497         }
00498 
00499         if ((parser->cfg.ch_erase == ch) || (parser->cfg.ch_del == ch)) {
00500             if (parser->user_buf_count > 0) {
00501                 parser->user_buf_count--;
00502             }
00503             if (parser->user_do_echo) {
00504                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\b');
00505             }
00506         } else if ((parser->user_buf_count + 1) < parser->user_buf_size) {
00507             parser->user_buf[parser->user_buf_count] = ch;
00508             parser->user_buf_count++;
00509             if (parser->user_do_echo) {
00510                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, ch);
00511             }
00512         }
00513         return CPARSER_OK;
00514     }
00515 
00516     switch (ch_type) {
00517         case CPARSER_CHAR_REGULAR:
00518         {
00519             if ((parser->cfg.ch_complete == ch) ||
00520                 (parser->cfg.ch_help == ch)) {
00521                 /*
00522                  * Completion and help character do not go into the line
00523                  * buffer. So, do nothing.
00524                  */
00525                 break;
00526             }
00527             if ((parser->cfg.ch_erase == ch) || (parser->cfg.ch_del == ch)) {
00528                 rc = cparser_line_delete(parser);
00529                 assert(CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS != rc);
00530                 if (CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST == rc) {
00531                     return CPARSER_OK;
00532                 }
00533             } else if ('\n' == ch) {
00534                 /* Put the rest of the line into parser FSM */
00535                 for (n = cparser_line_current(parser);
00536                      n < cparser_line_last(parser); n++) {
00537                     rc = cparser_fsm_input(parser, cparser_line_char(parser, n));
00538                     assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00539                 }
00540             } else {
00541                 (void)cparser_line_insert(parser, ch);
00542             }
00543             break;
00544         }
00545         case CPARSER_CHAR_UP_ARROW:
00546         {
00547             rc = cparser_line_prev_line(parser);
00548             assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00549 
00550             /* Reset the token stack and re-enter the command */
00551             cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00552             for (n = 0; n < cparser_line_current(parser); n++) {
00553                 rc = cparser_fsm_input(parser, cparser_line_char(parser, n));
00554                 assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00555             }
00556 
00557             return CPARSER_OK;
00558         }
00559         case CPARSER_CHAR_DOWN_ARROW:
00560         {
00561             rc = cparser_line_next_line(parser);
00562             assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00563 
00564             /* Reset the token stack and re-enter the command */
00565             cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00566             for (n = 0; n < cparser_line_current(parser); n++) {
00567                 rc = cparser_fsm_input(parser, cparser_line_char(parser, n));
00568                 assert(CPARSER_OK == rc);
00569             }
00570 
00571             return CPARSER_OK;
00572         }
00573         case CPARSER_CHAR_LEFT_ARROW:
00574         {
00575             ch = cparser_line_prev_char(parser);
00576             if (!ch) {
00577                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\a');
00578                 return CPARSER_OK;
00579             }
00580             break;
00581         }
00582         case CPARSER_CHAR_RIGHT_ARROW:
00583         {
00584             ch = cparser_line_next_char(parser);
00585             if (!ch) {
00586                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\a');
00587                 return CPARSER_OK;
00588             }
00589             break;
00590         }
00591         case CPARSER_CHAR_FIRST:
00592         {
00593             do {
00594                 ch = cparser_line_prev_char(parser);
00595                 if (ch) {
00596                     cparser_fsm_input(parser, ch);
00597                 }
00598             } while (ch);
00599             return CPARSER_OK;
00600         }
00601         case CPARSER_CHAR_LAST:
00602         {
00603             do {
00604                 ch = cparser_line_next_char(parser);
00605                 if (ch) {
00606                     cparser_fsm_input(parser, ch);
00607                 }
00608             } while (ch);
00609             return CPARSER_OK;
00610         }
00611         default:
00612         {
00613             /* An unknown character. Alert and continue */
00614             parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\a');
00615             return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00616         }
00617     } /* switch (ch_type) */
00618 
00619     /* Handle special characters */
00620     if (ch == parser->cfg.ch_complete) {
00621         while (cparser_complete_one_level(parser));
00622         return CPARSER_OK;
00623     } else if (ch == parser->cfg.ch_help) {
00624         /* Ask for context sensitve help */
00625         cparser_help(parser);
00626         return CPARSER_OK;
00627     } else if ('\n' == ch) {
00628         rc = cparser_execute_cmd(parser);
00629         cparser_line_advance(parser);
00630         return rc;
00631     }
00632 
00633     return cparser_fsm_input(parser, (char)ch);
00634 }
00635 
00636 cparser_result_t
00637 cparser_run (cparser_t *parser)
00638 {
00639     int ch;
00640     cparser_char_t ch_type = 0;
00641 
00642     if (!VALID_PARSER(parser)) return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00643 
00644     parser->cfg.io_init(parser);
00645     cparser_print_prompt(parser);
00646     parser->done = 0;
00647 
00648     while (!parser->done) {
00649         parser->cfg.getch(parser, &ch, &ch_type);
00650         cparser_input(parser, ch, ch_type);
00651     } /* while not done */
00652 
00653     parser->cfg.io_cleanup(parser);
00654 
00655     return CPARSER_OK;
00656 }
00657 
00658 cparser_result_t
00659 cparser_init (cparser_cfg_t *cfg, cparser_t *parser)
00660 {
00661     int n;
00662 
00663     if (!parser || !cfg || !cfg->root || !cfg->ch_erase) {
00664     return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00665     }
00666 
00667     parser->cfg = *cfg;
00668     parser->cfg.prompt[CPARSER_MAX_PROMPT-1] = '\0';
00669 
00670     /* Initialize sub-mode states */
00671     parser->root_level = 0;
00672     parser->root[0] = parser->cfg.root;
00673     snprintf(parser->prompt[0], sizeof(parser->prompt[0]), "%s",
00674              parser->cfg.prompt);
00675     for (n = 0; n < CPARSER_MAX_NESTED_LEVELS; n++) {
00676         parser->context.cookie[n] = NULL;
00677     }
00678     parser->context.parser = parser;
00679 
00680     /* Initialize line buffering states */
00681     parser->max_line = 0;
00682     parser->cur_line = 0;
00683     for (n = 0; n < CPARSER_MAX_LINES; n++) {
00684         cparser_line_reset(&parser->lines[n]);
00685     }
00686 
00687     /* Initialize parser FSM state */
00688     cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00689     parser->is_privileged_mode = 0;
00690 
00691     /* Clear the user input state */
00692     cparser_input_reset(parser);
00693 
00694     return CPARSER_OK;
00695 }
00696 
00697 cparser_result_t
00698 cparser_quit (cparser_t *parser)
00699 {
00700     if (!parser) {
00701         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00702     }
00703     parser->done = 1;
00704     return CPARSER_OK;
00705 }
00706 
00707 cparser_result_t
00708 cparser_submode_enter (cparser_t *parser, void *cookie, char *prompt)
00709 {
00710     cparser_node_t *new_root;
00711 
00712     if (!parser) {
00713         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00714     }
00715     if ((CPARSER_MAX_NESTED_LEVELS-1) == parser->root_level) {
00716         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00717     }
00718     parser->root_level++;
00719     new_root = parser->cur_node->children;
00720     assert(new_root);
00721     assert(CPARSER_NODE_ROOT == new_root->type);
00722     parser->root[parser->root_level] = new_root;
00723     snprintf(parser->prompt[parser->root_level],
00724              sizeof(parser->prompt[parser->root_level]), "%s", prompt);
00725     parser->context.cookie[parser->root_level] = cookie;
00726 
00727     return CPARSER_OK;
00728 }
00729 
00730 cparser_result_t
00731 cparser_submode_exit (cparser_t *parser)
00732 {
00733     if (!parser) {
00734         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00735     }
00736     if (!parser->root_level) {
00737         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00738     }
00739     parser->root_level--;
00740     return CPARSER_OK;
00741 }
00742 
00743 cparser_result_t
00744 cparser_load_cmd (cparser_t *parser, char *filename)
00745 {
00746     FILE *fp;
00747     char buf[128];
00748     size_t rsize, n;
00749     int fd, indent = 0, last_indent = -1, new_line = 1, m, line_num = 0;
00750 
00751     if (!VALID_PARSER(parser) || !filename) {
00752         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00753     }
00754 
00755     fd = parser->cfg.fd;
00756     parser->cfg.fd = -1;
00757 
00758     fp = fopen(filename, "r");
00759     if (!fp) {
00760         return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00761     }
00762 
00763     cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00764     while (!feof(fp)) {
00765         rsize = fread(buf, 1, sizeof(buf), fp);
00766         for (n = 0; n < rsize; n++) {
00767             /* Examine the input characters to maintain indent level */
00768             if ('\n' == buf[n]) {
00769                 cparser_result_t rc;
00770                 char buf[128];
00771 
00772                 line_num++;
00773                 indent = 0;
00774                 new_line = 1;
00775                 rc = cparser_execute_cmd(parser);
00776                 if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00777                     continue;
00778                 }
00779                 parser->cfg.fd = fd;
00780                 switch (rc) {
00781                 case CPARSER_ERR_PARSE_ERR:
00782                     snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "Line %d: Parse error.\n", line_num);
00783                     parser->cfg.prints(parser, buf);
00784                     break;
00785                 case CPARSER_ERR_INCOMP_CMD:
00786                     snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "Line %d: Incomplete command.\n", line_num);
00787                     parser->cfg.prints(parser, buf);
00788                     break;
00789                 default:
00790                     assert(0);
00791                 }
00792                 return CPARSER_NOT_OK;
00793             } else if (' ' == buf[n]) {
00794                 if (new_line) {
00795                     indent++;
00796                 }
00797             } else {
00798                 if (new_line) {
00799                     new_line = 0;
00800                     if (indent < last_indent) {
00801                         for (m = indent; m < last_indent; m++) {
00802                             if (CPARSER_OK != cparser_submode_exit(parser)) {
00803                                 break;
00804                             }
00805                             cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00806                         }
00807                     }
00808                     last_indent = indent;
00809                 }
00810             }
00811             (void)cparser_fsm_input(parser, buf[n]);
00812         }
00813     }
00814     fclose(fp);
00815 
00816     while (parser->root_level) {
00817         (void)cparser_submode_exit(parser);
00818         cparser_fsm_reset(parser);
00819     }
00820     parser->cfg.fd = fd;
00821     return CPARSER_OK;
00822 }
00823 
00824 static cparser_result_t
00825 cparser_walk_internal (cparser_t *parser, cparser_node_t *node,
00826                        cparser_walker_fn pre_fn, cparser_walker_fn post_fn,
00827                        void *cookie)
00828 {
00829     cparser_result_t rc;
00830     cparser_node_t *cur_node;
00831 
00832     if (pre_fn) {
00833         rc = pre_fn(parser, node, cookie);
00834         if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00835             return rc;
00836         }
00837     }
00838 
00839     if (CPARSER_NODE_END != node->type) {
00840         cur_node = node->children;
00841         while (cur_node) {
00842             cparser_walk_internal(parser, cur_node, pre_fn, post_fn, cookie);
00843             cur_node = cur_node->sibling;
00844         }
00845     }
00846 
00847     if (post_fn) {
00848         rc = post_fn(parser, node, cookie);
00849         if (CPARSER_OK != rc) {
00850             return rc;
00851         }
00852     }
00853 
00854     return CPARSER_OK;
00855 }
00856 
00857 cparser_result_t
00858 cparser_walk (cparser_t *parser, cparser_walker_fn pre_fn,
00859               cparser_walker_fn post_fn, void *cookie)
00860 {
00861     if (!VALID_PARSER(parser) || (!pre_fn && !post_fn)) {
00862         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
00863     }
00864 
00865     return cparser_walk_internal(parser, parser->root[parser->root_level],
00866                                  pre_fn, post_fn, cookie);
00867 }
00868 
00869 typedef struct help_stack_ {
00870     char *filter;
00871     int  tos;
00872     cparser_node_t *nodes[CPARSER_MAX_NUM_TOKENS+2];
00873 } help_stack_t;
00874 
00886 static cparser_result_t
00887 cparser_help_pre_walker (cparser_t *parser, cparser_node_t *node, void *cookie)
00888 {
00889     help_stack_t *hs = (help_stack_t *)cookie;
00890 
00891     assert(parser && node && hs);
00892     hs->nodes[hs->tos] = node;
00893     hs->tos++;
00894 
00895     return CPARSER_OK;
00896 }
00897 
00909 static cparser_result_t
00910 cparser_help_post_walker (cparser_t *parser, cparser_node_t *node, void *cookie)
00911 {
00912     help_stack_t *hs = (help_stack_t *)cookie;
00913     int n, do_print;
00914 
00915     assert(parser && node && hs);
00916     if ((CPARSER_NODE_END == node->type) &&
00917         (!(node->flags & CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_PARTIAL))) {
00918         do_print = 0;
00919         if (hs->filter) {
00920             /* We have a filter string. Check if it matches any keyword */
00921             for (n = 0; n < hs->tos; n++) {
00922                 if (CPARSER_NODE_LIST == hs->nodes[n]->type) {
00923                     /* LIST node requires an extra walk of all keywords in the list */
00924                     cparser_list_node_t *lnode =
00925                         (cparser_list_node_t *)hs->nodes[n]->param;
00926                     assert(lnode);
00927                     while (lnode) {
00928                         if (strstr(lnode->keyword, hs->filter)) {
00929                             do_print = 1;
00930                             break;
00931                         }
00932                         lnode = lnode->next;
00933                     }
00934                     if (do_print) {
00935                         break;
00936                     }
00937                 }
00938                 if (CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD != hs->nodes[n]->type) {
00939                     continue;
00940                 }
00941                 if (strstr(hs->nodes[n]->param, hs->filter)) {
00942                     do_print = 1; /* Yes, print it */
00943                     break;
00944                 }
00945             }
00946             if (!NODE_USABLE(parser, node)) {
00947                 do_print = 0; /* may match the filter but not usable */
00948             }
00949         } else if (NODE_USABLE(parser, node)) {
00950             do_print = 1;
00951         }
00952         if (do_print) {
00953             cparser_node_t *cur_node;
00954             int m, num_braces = 0;
00955 
00956             if (node->desc) {
00957                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, node->desc);
00958                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, "\r\n  ");
00959             } else {
00960                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, "\r  ");
00961             }
00962             for (n = 0; n < hs->tos; n++) {
00963                 cur_node = hs->nodes[n];
00964                 if ((CPARSER_NODE_ROOT == cur_node->type) ||
00965                     (CPARSER_NODE_END == cur_node->type)) {
00966                     continue;
00967                 }
00968                 if (cur_node->flags & CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_START) {
00969                     parser->cfg.prints(parser, "{ ");
00970                     num_braces++;
00971                 }
00972                 cparser_help_print_node(parser, cur_node, 0, 0);
00973                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, ' ');
00974                 if (cur_node->flags & CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_OPT_END) {
00975                     for (m = 0; m < num_braces; m++) {
00976                         parser->cfg.prints(parser, "} ");
00977                     }
00978                 }
00979             }
00980             parser->cfg.prints(parser, "\r\n\n");
00981         }
00982     }
00983 
00984     /* Pop the stack */
00985     hs->tos--;
00986     return CPARSER_OK;
00987 }
00988 
00989 cparser_result_t
00990 cparser_help_cmd (cparser_t *parser, char *str)
00991 {
00992     help_stack_t help_stack;
00993 
00994     assert(parser);
00995     memset(&help_stack, 0, sizeof(help_stack));
00996     help_stack.filter = str;
00997     return cparser_walk(parser, cparser_help_pre_walker,
00998                         cparser_help_post_walker, &help_stack);
00999 }
01000 
01001 cparser_result_t
01002 cparser_set_root_context (cparser_t *parser, void *context)
01003 {
01004     if (!parser) {
01005         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
01006     }
01007     parser->context.cookie[0] = context;
01008     return CPARSER_OK;
01009 }
01010 
01011 cparser_result_t
01012 cparser_get_root_context (cparser_t *parser, void **context)
01013 {
01014     if (!parser || !context) {
01015         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
01016     }
01017     *context = parser->context.cookie[0];
01018     return CPARSER_OK;
01019 }
01020 
01021 cparser_result_t
01022 cparser_set_privileged_mode (cparser_t *parser, int enable)
01023 {
01024     if (!parser) {
01025         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
01026     }
01027     parser->is_privileged_mode = (0 != enable);
01028     return CPARSER_OK;
01029 }
01030 
01031 int
01032 cparser_is_in_privileged_mode (const cparser_t *parser)
01033 {
01034     if (!parser) {
01035         return 0;
01036     }
01037     return (parser->is_privileged_mode ? 1 : 0);
01038 }
01039 
01040 cparser_result_t
01041 cparser_user_input (cparser_t *parser, const char *prompt, int do_echo,
01042                     char *buf, int buf_size, cparser_input_cb cb)
01043 {
01044     int tmp_do_echo;
01045 
01046     if (!parser || !buf || !buf_size || !buf_size) {
01047         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
01048     }
01049 
01050     if (cparser_is_user_input(parser, &tmp_do_echo)) {
01051         return CPARSER_NOT_OK; /* only one user input at a time */
01052     }
01053 
01054     /* Print the prompt */
01055     if (prompt) {
01056         parser->cfg.prints(parser, prompt);
01057     }
01058 
01059     /* Save the state */
01060     parser->user_buf = buf;
01061     parser->user_buf_size = buf_size;
01062     parser->user_input_cb = cb;
01063     parser->user_do_echo = do_echo;
01064     assert(!parser->user_buf_count);
01065 
01066     return CPARSER_OK;
01067 }
01068 
01069 cparser_result_t
01070 cparser_abort_user_input (cparser_t *parser)
01071 {
01072     int do_echo;
01073 
01074     if (!parser) {
01075         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
01076     }
01077     if (!cparser_is_user_input(parser, &do_echo)) {
01078         return CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST;
01079     }
01080 
01081     /* Force a callback immediately with an empty input */
01082     parser->user_buf[0] = '\0';
01083     parser->user_input_cb(parser, parser->user_buf, 0);
01084 
01085     cparser_input_reset(parser);
01086     cparser_print_prompt(parser);
01087 
01088     return CPARSER_OK;
01089 }
01090 
01091 cparser_result_t
01092 cparser_last_command (cparser_t *parser, char **cmd,
01093                       cparser_result_t *rc, int *is_priv)
01094 {
01095     if (!parser) {
01096         return CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS;
01097     }
01098     if (0 <= parser->last_line_idx) {
01099         if (cmd) {
01100             *cmd = parser->lines[parser->last_line_idx].buf;
01101         }
01102         if (rc) {
01103             *rc = parser->last_rc;
01104         }
01105         if (is_priv) {
01106             *is_priv = (!parser->last_end_node ? 0 :
01107                         (parser->last_end_node->flags &
01108                          CPARSER_NODE_FLAGS_HIDDEN ? 1 : 0));
01109         }
01110     } else {
01111         assert((CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST == parser->last_rc) &&
01112                (!parser->last_end_node));
01113         if (cmd) {
01114             *cmd = NULL;
01115         }
01116         if (rc) {
01117             *rc = parser->last_rc;
01118         }
01119         if (is_priv) {
01120             *is_priv = 0;
01121         }
01122     }
01123     return CPARSER_OK;
01124 }
